relevant_quotes: This study investigates whether coupling crop modeling and machine learning (ML) improves corn yield predictions in the US Corn Belt.

The main objectives are to explore whether a hybrid approach (crop modeling + ML) would result in better predictions, investigate which combinations of hybrid models provide the most accurate predictions, and determine the features from the crop modeling that are most effective to be integrated with ML for corn yield prediction.
